intro: Rennera eenii, commonly known as the slender rennera, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes sedges and buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Rennera eenii typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
